reg:regulation.reg:title: Spill Reporting Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 221/2017, December 5, 2017]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Environmental Management Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a stream, as defined in the Water Sustainability Act,
an aquifer, as defined in the Water Sustainability Act,
fish habitat, as defined in the Water Sustainability Regulation, B.C. Reg. 36/2016, and
any of the following that could drain or empty directly into a body of water:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a naturally formed pool of water other than one referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c);
a ditch;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: contact information, in relation to a person, means the address, telephone number and, if any, email address of the person;
emergency response completion date, in relation to a spill, has the meaning given in section 8 [emergency response completion date];

listed quantity, in relation to a listed substance, means the quantity listed in Column 2 of the Schedule opposite the listed substance or, if more than one quantity is listed, the highest of those quantities;
listed substance means a substance listed in Column 1 of the Schedule;
Provincial Emergency Program has the same meaning as in the Emergency Program Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation applies for the purposes of section 91.2 (1) (a) [responsible persons — spill response] of the Act in relation to a spill of a listed substance, other than natural gas, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the spill enters, or is likely to enter, a body of water, or
the quantity of the substance spilled is, or is likely to be, equal to or greater than the listed quantity for the listed substance.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation applies for the purposes of section 91.2 (1) (a) [responsible persons — spill response] of the Act in relation to a spill of natural gas if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the spill is caused by a break in a pipeline or fitting operated above 100 psi that results in a sudden and uncontrolled release of natural gas, and
the quantity of natural gas spilled is, or is likely to be, equal to or greater than the listed quantity for natural gas.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a spill occurs or is at imminent risk of occurring, a responsible person must ensure that the actual or potential spill is immediately reported to the Provincial Emergency Program by calling 1-800-663-3456.
A report under this section must include, to the extent practicable, the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contact information for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the individual making the report,
the responsible person in relation to the spill, and
the owner of the substance spilled;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date and time of the spill;
the location of the spill site;
a description of the spill site and the surrounding area;
a description of the source of the spill;
the type and quantity of the substance spilled;
a description of the circumstances, cause and adverse effects of the spill;
details of action taken or proposed to comply with section 91.2 (2) [responsible persons — spill response] of the Act;
the names of the government, federal government, local government and first nation government agencies at the spill site;
the names of other persons or government, federal government, local government or first nation government agencies advised about the spill.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A responsible person for a spill that occurs on or after October 30, 2018 must, until the emergency response completion date, submit written reports on the spill to the minister in accordance with subsection (2).
A report under subsection (1) must be made

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: as soon as practicable on request of the minister,
at least once every 30 days after the date the spill began, and
at any time the responsible person has reason to believe that information previously reported by the responsible person under section 4 or this section was or has become inaccurate or incomplete.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A report under this section must be made in the manner and form specified by the minister and must include, to the extent practicable, the information set out in section 6 (2).

The responsible person for a spill that occurs on or after October 30, 2018 must submit a written report on the spill to the minister within 30 days after the emergency response completion date for that spill.
A report under this section must be made in the manner and form specified by the minister and must include the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contact information of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the responsible person, and
the owner of the substance spilled;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date, time and duration of the spill;
the location of the spill site, which must be specified by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: its address, if any, and
its latitude and longitude;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the spill site and sites affected by the spill;
a description of the source of the spill;
the type and quantity of the substance spilled;
a description of the circumstances, cause and adverse effects of the spill, including, without limitation, a description of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the activity during which the spill occurred (e.g., transportation, transfer of cargo, fuelling, cleaning, maintenance);
the incident leading to the spill (e.g., tank rupture, overfill, collision, rollover, derailment, fire, explosion);
the underlying cause of the spill (e.g., human error, external conditions, organizational or management failure);
the adverse effects of the spill to human health, which must specify
the adverse effects of the spill to the environment and infrastructure at the spill site and the area surrounding the spill, which description must specify

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the size of the area adversely affected by the spill,
the biological and other resources adversely affected by the spill, including, without limitation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: details of action taken to comply with section 91.2 [responsible persons — spill response] of the Act;
how and where waste from the spill was disposed of;
a copy of data from and reports of sampling, testing, monitoring and assessing carried out during spill response actions;
a map of the spill site and the area surrounding the spill and photographs of the spill;
the names of agencies on the scene;
the names of other persons or agencies advised about the spill.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A director may order a responsible person in relation to a spill of a listed substance to submit a written report on the spill to the director.
An order under subsection (1) must be made in writing and within 6 months after the emergency response completion date for the spill.
A responsible person to whom an order under subsection (1) is directed must submit the report to the director in the manner and form specified by the director and must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the effectiveness of the spill response actions,
a description of actions taken to prevent future spills and improve response to future spills,
if the responsible person is a regulated person,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a description of any changes that the person intends to make to the person's spill contingency plan to improve response to future spills,

if the spill occurred in a geographic response area, a description of any changes that the person considers should be made to the related geographic response plan to improve response to future spills, and
if spill response actions were carried out by a PRO, a description of any changes that the person considers should be made to the PRO's area response plan to improve response to future spills, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: responses to any specific questions the director asks in the order.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of this regulation, the emergency response completion date for a spill is the date on which all of the following criteria are met:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the incident command post is disestablished;
the source of the spill is under control and is neither spilling nor at imminent risk of spilling;
emergency actions to stabilize, contain and remove the spill have been taken;
the waste removed from the spill site has been

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: received at a facility for disposal, or
received for transportation to a facility for disposal;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if applicable, all notices respecting evacuation from the spill site have expired or been rescinded;
all equipment, personnel and other resources used in emergency spill response actions have been removed from the spill site, other than equipment, personnel or other resources required for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: sampling, testing, monitoring or assessing at the spill site, or
recovery or restoration of the spill site.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application to oil and gas permit holders
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following sections do not apply to a person who holds a permit to carry out an oil or gas activity to which the Emergency Management Regulation, B.C. Reg. 204/2013, applies:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 5 [updates to minister];
section 6 [end-of-spill report];
section 7 [lessons-learned report].

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Schedule, Federal Regulations means the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations made under the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act, 1992 (Canada).
